examples: Over the years, the company has broken fresh ground in many different areas, from technology to healthcare.
Mask shortages mean that healthcare workers are having trouble getting a hold of masks, which puts everyone at risk.

words.defineEn: the health services and  treatments given to people
words.defineVi: các dịch vụ y tế và phương pháp điều trị được cung cấp cho mọi người

examples: Because so many other social issues take priority for the government, the welfare of children in the foster-care system often ends up falling through the cracks.

Welfare carry Richard linkage between cover Mr. Carter.

Years ago, we didn't fully understand animal welfare as well as we do now.
words.defineEn: the well-being and happiness of an individual or a group
words.defineVi: hạnh phúc và hạnh phúc của một cá nhân hoặc một nhóm

examples: This new medicine is a beacon of hope for/to thousands of people.

words.defineEn: a substance that treats injuries or illnesses
words.defineVi: một chất điều trị chấn thương hoặc bệnh tật

examples: The rest of his money went into medical expenses.

examples: She left a positive review online for the restaurant where she ordered a pizza.
If you invest time and energy into learning and personal growth, you will see positive results in your life.
Melissa's new book got off to a flying start, with high sales and positive reviews from readers and critics alike.
Consuming prunes may have a positive impact on heart health by reducing LDL cholesterol levels.
Sticks and stones may break my bones, but my positive attitude will never falter.

words.defineVi: (của một bài kiểm tra khoa học) cho thấy rằng một chất hoặc điều kiện cụ thể tồn tại

examples: She received false advice that led to negative consequences.

Criticizing the government for not doing enough to control the economy cuts both ways, as too much government intervention can also lead to negative consequences.
words.defineEn: (of a scientific test) showing that there is no sign of a disease or a particular condition
words.defineVi: (của một thử nghiệm khoa học) cho thấy không có dấu hiệu của bệnh hoặc tình trạng cụ thể

examples: Drugs are a ball and chain for many people.

words.defineEn: any substance that is used in medicine or as a medicine

examples: Take an aspirin and lie down.

He shot an aspirin out of the air in slow-motion.
Even though they're cousins, aspirin does not have those same effects in the skin.
words.defineEn: a type of medicine taken to relieve pain, bring down a fever, etc.
words.defineVi: một loại thuốc dùng để giảm đau, hạ sốt, v.v.

examples: She was given antibiotics.

Antibiotics DO NOT KILL VIRUSES.
They put antibiotics in it.

words.defineEn: a drug that is used to destroy bacteria or stop their growth, like Penicillin
words.defineVi: một loại thuốc được sử dụng để tiêu diệt vi khuẩn hoặc ngăn chặn sự phát triển của chúng, như Penicillin

examples: She collected capsules from various plants and carefully stored them for future study.

The children collected capsules from the oak trees, playing a game to see whose capsule would burst open first.
The capsules are supported on a cushion of air.
words.defineEn: a type of small, rounded drug that has medicine inside, which when swallowed releases its medical substance
words.defineVi: một loại thuốc nhỏ, tròn, bên trong có thuốc, khi nuốt sẽ giải phóng dược chất của nó

words.defineVi: một bộ dụng cụ và vật tư y tế, thường được đựng trong túi hoặc hộp, được sử dụng trong trường hợp khẩn cấp hoặc bị thương

examples: Fetch me a bandage and make it snappy!

words.defineVi: một mảnh vải quấn quanh vết thương để ngăn ngừa nhiễm trùng

examples: But that could just be a Band-Aid for the much larger issue.

If a guy shows up to the date with a band-aid on his wedding ring finger, that constitutes a bad date.
It's like using a Band-Aid to treat a broken bone instead of a comprehensive treatment plan.
words.defineEn: an adhesive bandage to cover small cuts or blisters
words.defineVi: băng dính để che vết cắt nhỏ hoặc vết phồng rộp

examples: That shot lost him the championship.

You're not calling the shots anymore.
words.defineEn: an act of a drug injection to the body

words.defineEn: to lose blood from an injury or wound
words.defineVi: để mất máu từ một vết thương hoặc vết thương

words.defineEn: the process of looking closely at something to see if there are any issues

examples: A stable relationship stands the test of time.

examples: Social workers operate on the razor’s edge.

words.defineEn: to cut open a part of the body in order to repair or remove a damaged organ
words.defineVi: để cắt mở một phần của cơ thể để sửa chữa hoặc loại bỏ một cơ quan bị hư hỏng

examples: Treat yourselves to a good meal.

words.defineVi: chữa vết thương hoặc chăm sóc y tế cho người bị thương

words.defineEn: an action that is done to relieve pain or cure a disease or an illness

words.defineVi: để trở nên khỏe mạnh một lần nữa hoặc làm cho ai đó lấy lại sức khỏe của họ

examples: As the saying goes, physician, heal thyself.

words.defineEn: to become healthy again

examples: She made a mental note to ask Alan about it.

examples: My dad spread a thick layer of orange marmalade on my morning toast.

words.defineEn: to affect more people or a wider area

Ben’s making a good recovery, touch wood.
words.defineEn: the process of becoming healthy again after an injury or disease
words.defineVi: quá trình trở nên khỏe mạnh trở lại sau một chấn thương hoặc bệnh tật
